intro: Calandrinia speciosa, commonly known as the showy sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom in the spring and early summer. Calandrinia speciosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
